title: Joy Williams' New American Songbook
teaser: The singer-songwriter and four-time Grammy-winner joins us with a playlist of what she considers quintessentially American music.
contentencoded:
Singer-songwriter and four-time Grammy-winner Joy Williams is a true American artist. Born just outside of Santa Cruz, California, she grew up listening to Billie Holiday and Janis Joplin. She later stole a lot of hearts as one half of the now-disbanded folk/Americana duo The Civil Wars.

Now out with her own solo album, “Venus,” she joins Here & Now’s Robin Young for our occasional American music series, asking musicians and music lovers to share a playlist of what they think is quintessentially American music.

5 American Song Picks From Joy Williams

Guest

  • Joy Williams, four-time Grammy Award-winning singer-songwriter, formerly of the duo The Civil Wars. Her new album is “Venus.” She tweets @joywilliams.
